bibl.title: Letter from Roger Brooke to Philip Showalter Hench, September 14, 1940

div1.p: Brooke writes that he would like to receive copies of Hench's memorandum on the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Roger Brooke to Philip Showalter Hench, September 14, 1940
div1.opener:
THE MEDICAL FIELD SERVICE SCHOOL
OFFICE OF THE COMMANDANT
CARLISLE BARRACKS, CARLISLE, PA.
September 14, 1940.
IN REPLY REFER TO: Dr. P. S. Hench,
102-110 Second Avenue S.W.,
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This communication acknowledges receipt of your
letter of September 12th re recent photographs made of the
model of Camp Lazear. I am very much gratified to learn
that the photographs are suitable for the objective you
have in mind.

When completed, and at your convenience, I would
be very glad indeed to receive a copy of your detailed
memorandum of the yellow fever experiments.

We are delighted to authorize you to make as many
additional copies as you desire.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Roger Brooke,
Brig. General, Med. Dept.,
Commandant. Gen. Brooke died
soon after the letter
